alert.note: Alert for Broward; Miami-Dade (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 03 at 4:10PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of South Florida, including the following counties, Broward and Miami-Dade. * WHEN...Until 615 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 409 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated that the heavy rains have moves north of the advisory area which produced 1 to 2 inches of rainfall. Additional light to moderate rains will continue over the advisory area for the next hour or two which can still produce rainfall amounts up to half an inch. These rains will continue to lead to possible minor flooding in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Lauderdale, Hollywood, Pompano Beach, Davie, Deerfield Beach, Tamarac, Margate, Lighthouse Point, Lauderdale-By-The- Sea, Surfside, Hallandale, Miami Gardens, Lauderhill, North Miami, Coconut Creek, North Miami Beach, Oakland Park, Aventura, Lauderdale Lakes and Dania Beach. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report flooding to your local law enforcement agency when you can do so safely.
